articles.headline: Gawker’s Moment of Truth
articles.snippet: Gawker Media, which built a digital empire on snark, now finds itself confronting the same challenges as the establishment media companies it once aimed to upset.
articles.abstract: Gawker Media, which built a digital empire on snark, now finds itself confronting the same challenges as the establishment media companies it once aimed to upset.
articles.lead_paragraph: “I’m pretty sure we have a revolution coming,” said Nick Denton, founder and chief executive of Gawker Media. “It’s not 100 percent guaranteed, but the existing corporate structure is looking pretty hollow.”

articles.headline: Chinese Hackers Circumvent Popular Web Privacy Tools
articles.snippet: Exploiting a vulnerability in server software used by Chinese Internet portals, hackers were able to unmask visitors to sites deemed hostile by the government.
articles.abstract: Exploiting a vulnerability in server software used by Chinese Internet portals, hackers were able to unmask visitors to sites deemed hostile by the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Chinese hackers have found a way around widely used privacy technology to target the creators and readers of web content that state censors have deemed hostile, according to new research.

articles.headline: California Cuts Farmers’ Share of Scant Water
articles.snippet: Farmers with longtime rights to California water will face cutbacks, the first reduction in their usage since 1977, state officials announced Friday.
articles.abstract: Farmers with longtime rights to California water will face cutbacks, the first reduction in their usage since 1977, state officials announced Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Farmers with rights to California water dating back more than a century will face sharp cutbacks, the first reduction in their water use since 1977, state officials announced Friday. The officials said that rights dating to 1903 would be restricted, and that such restrictions would grow as the summer months go on, with the state facing a prolonged drought that shows few signs of easing.

articles.headline: Business Leaders React With Dismay to Defeat of Trade Bill
articles.snippet: Corporate America has been nearly unified in its support of a deal that would lower various barriers to trade and investment between the United States and 11 other Pacific Rim nations.
articles.abstract: Corporate America has been nearly unified in its support of a deal that would lower various barriers to trade and investment between the United States and 11 other Pacific Rim nations.
articles.lead_paragraph: As big a setback as Friday’s vote on Capitol Hill was for President Obama’s efforts to advance his trade agenda, it was an even bigger rebuff for the leaders of American business.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz, Patricia Cohen and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: Jack Dorsey Returns to Twitter as Chief, to Shrugs and Quips
articles.snippet: Mr. Dorsey is a figure of legend to newer Twitter employees, and remembered with varying degrees of fondness and fear by those who worked with him during his earlier stints there.
articles.abstract: Mr. Dorsey is a figure of legend to newer Twitter employees, and remembered with varying degrees of fondness and fear by those who worked with him during his earlier stints there.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For the last two years, the normally dapper Jack Dorsey has hardly been seen at the offices of Twitter, the social networking company he co-founded, even though he works a block away. So he shocked many when he returned on Thursday with a beard so wild that his own mother made fun of it on Twitter.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: ISIS Is Winning the Social Media War, U.S. Concludes
articles.snippet: An internal State Department assessment says the Islamic State’s social message machine is trumping efforts by the Obama administration and its foreign allies to combat it.
articles.abstract: An internal State Department assessment says the Islamic State’s social message machine is trumping efforts by the Obama administration and its foreign allies to combat it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An internal State Department assessment paints a dismal picture of the efforts by the Obama administration and its foreign allies to combat the Islamic State’s message machine, portraying a fractured coalition that cannot get its own message straight.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: When Private Equity Firms Give Retirees the Short End
articles.snippet: Some private equity funds receive discounts on legal, accounting and other outside work, but their pension fund investors must pay full price, or more.
articles.abstract: Some private equity funds receive discounts on legal, accounting and other outside work, but their pension fund investors must pay full price, or more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Who comes first, the investors or the person who manages their money?

articles.headline: Labor’s Might Seen in Failure of Trade Deal as Unions Allied to Thwart It
articles.snippet: The labor movement’s unusual cohesion across various sectors of the economy helped derail the trade deal in Congress.
articles.abstract: The labor movement’s unusual cohesion across various sectors of the economy helped derail the trade deal in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Depleted by decades of diminishing reach and struggling to respond to recent anti-union laws, the labor movement has nonetheless found a way to assert itself politically by wreaking havoc on President Obama’s trade agenda, a top priority of his final years in office.

articles.headline: U.S. Is Poised to Put Heavy Weaponry in Eastern Europe
articles.snippet: The proposal, if approved, would represent the first time since the end of the Cold War that the United States has stationed heavy military equipment in Eastern Europe.
articles.abstract: The proposal, if approved, would represent the first time since the end of the Cold War that the United States has stationed heavy military equipment in Eastern Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIGA, Latvia — In a significant move to deter possible Russian aggression in Europe, the Pentagon is poised to store battle tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and other heavy weapons for as many as 5,000 American troops in several Baltic and Eastern European countries, American and allied officials say.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Pope Francis to Explore Climate’s Effect on World’s Poor
articles.snippet: When Francis releases his first major teaching letter on the theme of the environment and poverty, he may redefine a secular topic as a matter of morality.
articles.abstract: When Francis releases his first major teaching letter on the theme of the environment and poverty, he may redefine a secular topic as a matter of morality.
articles.lead_paragraph: VATICAN CITY — Ban Ki-moon arrived at the Vatican with his own college of cardinals. Mr. Ban, the United Nations secretary general, had brought the leaders of all his major agencies to see Pope Francis, a show of organizational muscle and respect for a meeting between two global institutions that had sometimes shared a bumpy past but now had a mutual interest.

articles.headline: Jeb Bush Works to Recover From a Shaky Start
articles.snippet: As he prepares to make his presidential campaign official on Monday, Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, finds himself part of a pack of candidates and the target of questions about his competence.
articles.abstract: As he prepares to make his presidential campaign official on Monday, Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, finds himself part of a pack of candidates and the target of questions about his competence.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jeb Bush had a plan for the last six months he spent as an unannounced candidate for president. He would raise tens of millions of dollars, distinguish himself from his brother’s controversial presidency, start winning over conservatives and establish himself as the Republican to beat for his party’s nomination.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Bid by Omar al-Bashir of Sudan to Avoid Arrest Is Tested in South Africa
articles.snippet: A South African court issued an interim order to prevent the Sudanese president from leaving the country after the International Criminal Court sought his arrest on genocide charges.
articles.abstract: A South African court issued an interim order to prevent the Sudanese president from leaving the country after the International Criminal Court sought his arrest on genocide charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — As the only head of state wanted by the International Criminal Court on genocide charges, President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan had spent years looking over his shoulder. He avoided countries where the risk of arrest seemed high. He visited friendly African nations hostile to the court, though he sometimes quickly left for home when the ground seemed to shift.

articles.headline: America’s Seniors Find Middle-Class ‘Sweet Spot’
articles.snippet: Those between 65 and 74, supported by Social Security, pensions and investments, have fared better than most other groups outside the superrich.
articles.abstract: Those between 65 and 74, supported by Social Security, pensions and investments, have fared better than most other groups outside the superrich.
articles.lead_paragraph: WAXAHACHIE, Tex. — Most Americans suffered serious losses during and after the recession, knocked off balance by layoffs, stagnant pay and the collapse of home values. But apart from the superrich, one group’s fortunes appear to have held remarkably steady: seniors.
articles.byline: By Dionne Searcey and Robert Gebeloff

articles.headline: With Little Fanfare, Mexican Supreme Court Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court of Mexico has said laws on the books in most of the country’s states are discriminatory, but gay couples still need costly injunctions from lower courts in order to wed.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court of Mexico has said laws on the books in most of the country’s states are discriminatory, but gay couples still need costly injunctions from lower courts in order to wed.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — His church turned him away, his family discouraged him from a public fight and the government of the state where he lives vowed it would never happen.
articles.byline: By Randal C. Archibold and Paulina Villegas

articles.headline: Same-Sex Parents’ Rights May Be Unresolved After Justices’ Ruling
articles.snippet: A Supreme Court endorsement of gay marriage would still leave many parents fighting to share custody of their same-sex partner’s children.
articles.abstract: A Supreme Court endorsement of gay marriage would still leave many parents fighting to share custody of their same-sex partner’s children.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jessica and Melissa Tincher take the four-hour road trip from their home in Lexington, Ohio, to visit relatives in Indiana, it is a two-vehicle affair: They need car seats for each of their four children — a 4-year-old, a 3-year-old and 2-year-old twins — along with Pack ’n Plays, high chairs, diapers and enough toys to keep everyone entertained. And then there are the two dogs, who together weigh 165 pounds.

articles.headline: U.S. Airstrike in Libya Targets Planner of 2013 Algeria Attack
articles.snippet: Libyan officials said the strike killed Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a former Al Qaeda leader and the mastermind of a 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead.
articles.abstract: Libyan officials said the strike killed Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a former Al Qaeda leader and the mastermind of a 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States carried out an airstrike in Libya early Sunday against the mastermind of the 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead, American and Libyan officials said on Sunday.

articles.headline: Hope and Despair as Families Languish in Texas Immigration Centers
articles.snippet: Federal officials say a large immigration center in Texas is crucial to averting another mass influx, but the women there find the detention taking a severe toll.
articles.abstract: Federal officials say a large immigration center in Texas is crucial to averting another mass influx, but the women there find the detention taking a severe toll.
articles.lead_paragraph: DILLEY, Tex. — Workers are putting the finishing touches on rows of barracks in a 50-acre camp here, the largest immigration detention center in the country. It houses thousands of women and their children who were caught crossing the border illegally and are seeking asylum in the United States.

articles.headline: Fears of Greek Default Rise as Weekend Talks on Debt Payment Break Down
articles.snippet: The lack of progress increases the possibility that Greece will be forced to default on its mountain of debt, with 1.6 billion euros owed to the International Monetary Fund on June 30.
articles.abstract: The lack of progress increases the possibility that Greece will be forced to default on its mountain of debt, with 1.6 billion euros owed to the International Monetary Fund on June 30.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Just weeks before a crucial debt payment comes due, weekend talks between Greece and its European creditors broke down as both sides refused to soften their long-held bargaining positions.
articles.byline: By James Kanter and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: Virtual Reality Headsets, Gaining Scrutiny at E3 This Week, Raise Very Real Concerns
articles.snippet: Users of the new generation of these devices will have to navigate the physical and emotional challenges of their real-life and simulated surroundings, often at the same time.
articles.abstract: Users of the new generation of these devices will have to navigate the physical and emotional challenges of their real-life and simulated surroundings, often at the same time.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every Friday, a dozen or so people strap on virtual reality headsets, log on to the Internet and do something that would normally require driving to a local multiplex: watch a movie with a bunch of strangers.

articles.headline: Under Armour Is Swinging for the Stars
articles.snippet: As the sportswear maker finds itself in business with two of the hottest athletes in the country, it is still figuring out how best to capitalize on those relationships.
articles.abstract: As the sportswear maker finds itself in business with two of the hottest athletes in the country, it is still figuring out how best to capitalize on those relationships.
articles.lead_paragraph: Before he watched the final round of the Masters tournament at Augusta National Golf Club in April, Ryan Kuehl, an executive for the sportswear company Under Armour, left his cellphone in a rented sport utility vehicle. Hours later — after the 21-year-old Jordan Spieth had won in record fashion — Mr. Kuehl checked his phone.

articles.headline: Engaging Movie Fans, From Teaser to Premiere
articles.snippet: A California start-up helps studios cultivate potential audiences’ enthusiasm with early sales of tickets and movie-related products.
articles.abstract: A California start-up helps studios cultivate potential audiences’ enthusiasm with early sales of tickets and movie-related products.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA MONICA, Calif. — Next month, 130,000 sweaty fans will swarm the San Diego Convention Center for the annual pop culture scavenger hunt known as Comic-Con International.

articles.headline: The Trans-Pacific Partnership and a President’s Legacy
articles.snippet: The 12-nation deal President Obama has been negotiating in Asia could be imperiled, not by uncertainty abroad, but by challenges at home trying to convince Democrats of the deal’s importance.
articles.abstract: The 12-nation deal President Obama has been negotiating in Asia could be imperiled, not by uncertainty abroad, but by challenges at home trying to convince Democrats of the deal’s importance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For more than six years, the short walk from the Oval Office downstairs to the Situation Room has all too often meant bad news or grim choices. Whether it was war in the Middle East, Russian aggression in Ukraine or the hunt for terrorists around the globe, President Obama’s foreign policy has felt consumed by guns and drones.

articles.headline: EasyJet Chief Leads Airline Through Turnaround
articles.snippet: Carolyn McCall, who took the helm in 2010, has changed the carrier from a company in chaos to one with rising profits in a competitive industry.
articles.abstract: Carolyn McCall, who took the helm in 2010, has changed the carrier from a company in chaos to one with rising profits in a competitive industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Early in a May conference call with journalists to discuss easyJet’s first-half results, Carolyn McCall, the low-cost airline’s chief executive, seemed puzzled to find herself being grilled about toilets.

articles.headline: Jeb Bush Announces White House Bid, Saying ‘America Deserves Better’
articles.snippet: Mr. Bush declared he was running for president, and called upon his own record of ambitious, conservative-minded change as Florida’s chief executive.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bush declared he was running for president, and called upon his own record of ambitious, conservative-minded change as Florida’s chief executive.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Jeb Bush, a son and brother of presidents, formally declared a White House candidacy of his own on Monday, portraying himself as the most accomplished leader in the 2016 field, vowing to wage war on Washington’s political culture and insisting that his family name gave him no unique claim to the Oval Office.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: CVS to Buy 1,600 Drugstores From Target for $1.9 Billion
articles.snippet: Under the deal, CVS would acquire more than 1,600 pharmacies from Target in 47 states and operate them under its brand name within Target stores.
articles.abstract: Under the deal, CVS would acquire more than 1,600 pharmacies from Target in 47 states and operate them under its brand name within Target stores.
articles.lead_paragraph: The voracious CVS Health is already a dominant player in nearly every corner of the health care world — it is the nation’s largest dispenser of prescription drugs, the biggest operator of health care clinics and the second-largest pharmacy-benefits manager.
articles.byline: By Katie Thomas, Chad Bray and Hiroko Tabuchi

articles.headline: Boston Muslims Struggle to Wrest Image of Islam From Terrorists
articles.snippet: The recent fatal shooting of a Muslim man who pulled a knife on the police is yet another episode that weighs heavily on a mosque in Boston.
articles.abstract: The recent fatal shooting of a Muslim man who pulled a knife on the police is yet another episode that weighs heavily on a mosque in Boston.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Yusufi Vali was hunched over his computer at this city’s biggest mosque, where he is executive director, when the first phone call came. The police had killed a man a few miles away. Soon there were reports that the man was a Muslim who had been under investigation for terrorism.

articles.headline: Modi’s Yoga Day Grips India, and ‘Om’ Meets ‘Ouch!’
articles.snippet: Yoga Day, the latest initiative introduced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has proved to be a cultural challenge in New Delhi, a capital diagnosed by some as having a “Western lifestyle.”
articles.abstract: Yoga Day, the latest initiative introduced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has proved to be a cultural challenge in New Delhi, a capital diagnosed by some as having a “Western lifestyle.”
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — On a sticky morning last week, Deputy Commissioner Chandra Shekhar Sahukar of India’s Agriculture Ministry (animal husbandry department, small ruminant section) found himself in a yoga class for the first time in his 57 years, miserably grasping his ankle.
